title: Domaine Boyar 2015 Muscat (Thracian Valley)
description: This wine has enticing aromas of jasmine, white peach and orange blossom. It is well balanced with flavors of apricot and tangerine on the palate and a touch of bright orange flavor in the finish.

title: Domaine Charles Frey 2016 Cuvée de l'Ours Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: The nose is very shy and just gives brief glimpses of pear fruit. The palate is a little dilute but has enough fruit to capture the appeal of pear-scented Pinot Gris. The body is rounded, has a pleasantly bitter edge and finishes dry.

title: Château de l'Aubrade 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Crisp and taut, this Lobre family wine is on a tight rope. It balances between intense citrus acidity and riper apricot and pear favors. It will be better from late 2017.

title: Château d'Haurets 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: With big, fruity flavors, this is a ripe while also crisp wine. Delicious green and citrus fruits give plenty of acidity along with a sense of richness. Drink this wine now.

title: Château Roc Meynard 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Crisp and with a strongly mineral character, this is a young, textured wine. As it softens and gets the ripeness of the vintage, it will become smooth and rich. Drink from late 2017.

title: 14 Hands 2014 Limited Release Kentucky Derby Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas are light, with notes of matchstick, herb and cherry. The cherry and plum flavors are sweet and generous, providing easy-drinking appeal.

title: AronHill 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Crisp pear, baked orange, sandalwood and smoke show on the nose of this bottling. Sweet ripe peach permeates the palate, but a lemon wedge and savory sea salt sprinkling brings everything into balance.

title: Avanzi 2013 Borghetta  (Lugana)
description: Aromas of French oak, butter and a whiff of orchard fruit lead the nose. The oak sensations carry over to the palate along with yellow apple skin, lemon zest and a hint of sage. It closes on a note of bitter almond.

title: Balletto 2016 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a richer, rounder version of rosé, with tropical mango and pineapple notes as well as lush peach aspects. Moderate acidity keeps it grounded and refreshing.

title: Bodega Otto Bestué 2016 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: Briny stone fruit aromas lead to a pulpy palate in this medium-bodied wine. Its ripe white fruit flavors show no signs of oak, tasting melony and finishing short. Drink as soon as possible for best results.

title: Bodegas San Valero 2013 Particular Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Oak-heavy wood spice, plum and leather aromas open this Garnacha. On the palate, it's syrupy and heavy, with sweet cassis and blackberry flavors blanketed with oak, finishing jammy and resiny.

title: Bonterra 2015 Viognier (California)
description: This light, fruity and refreshing wine is made from organic grapes and pairs nicely with linguine and clams or pizza bianca. Although matured in French oak barrels, it's more delicate than usual, tasting of apples, baking spice and fresh lemon.

title: Noble Tree 2014 Wicker Sham Ranch Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Inky color and intense leather, chocolate and smoke notes provide context and character to this inexpensive offering, which finishes with ripe, jammy blackberry and brown sugar flavors.

title: The Great Oregon Wine Company 2016 Rose City Rosé (Willamette Valley)
description: Simple and light, this all-Pinot Noir rosé offers dilute flavors of pink grapefruit and strawberries. It's finished dry and goes down cheerfully, though there's a suggestion of bitter gunmetal in the finish.

title: Three 2013 Suscol Creek Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Woody and dry with tannin, this wine shows sizable oak and body and generously ripe cassis and cherry flavors. Sage and cedar notes play off the fruit.

title: Santa Ema 2016 Select Terroir Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Plum aromas are a bit herbal and leafy. This is fresh and fairly well balanced for value-priced Carmenère. Flavors of herbal berry fruits and oak are basic but good, while this tastes minty, spicy and mildly oaky on an early exiting finish.

title: Santa Rita 2015 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
description: Mild peach aromas are honeyed, with an oaky note of vanilla. This is melony and plump on the palate, with just enough acidity to create balance. Mild flavors of melon and white fruits are largely generic, while this tastes yeasty, oaky and a touch buttery on the finish.

title: Quai de la Lune 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine is ripe and smooth, with some spicy red-currant fruits. The delicious, crisp aftertaste is full of fruit, with a lightly yeasty character. Drink now.

title: Gavilan 2014 Chardonnay (Chalone)
description: Butterscotch, lemon peel and a faint flinty quality show on the nose of this bottling from the Chalone team. Tangy mandarin flavors meet almond butter, honeysuckle and gunmetal touches on the palate.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2015 Merlot (Central Coast)
description: Iron-laced beef aromas meet boysenberry and wet stone on the nose of this widely available and smartly priced wine from the historic producer. Red cherry fruit shows on the palate along with a touch of turned earth, making for a pleasant yet simple sip.

title: Enate 2016 234 Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: This mild, plump and basic Chardonnay leads with peach blossom, yeast and cured ham scents. Its melon, peach and apricot flavors hollow out on a mild, yeasty tasting finish.

title: Enotria 2014 Uvaggio Isabella Arneis (Mendocino County)
description: The floral aromas in this animated wine give way to fragrant fruit salad flavors that range from orange to pineapple to apple. It has a nicely tart texture and lingering fruity finish.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 V Verdelho (Alentejano)
description: The wine brings out a strongly herbal, tangy character in this perfumed grape. With spice and intense acidity, the wine is still young, still with a closed character. This needs to be drunk from late 2017 or even 2018.

title: Kokomo 2016 Timber Crest Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Muted stone fruit and melon flavors mark this vineyard designate, framed by a steely, simple texture and punctuated by bright sparks of orange and lemon peel.

title: Fetzer NV Anthony's Hill Dark Bold Red (California)
description: Not quite as bold as its name suggests, this wine is well-balanced and fun to sip. Fruity and medium-bodied, it smells like raspberries and rhubarb, tastes like red cherries and feels nicely full on the palate, bolstered by a hearty dose of fine tannins.

title: Feudo Maccari 2016 Rosé (Terre Siciliane)
description: With its delicate onion-peel color and rather subdued aromas, this rosato appears older than it is. The palate is a bit more expressive and slightly fresher, offering suggestions of tart apple and sour cherry before finishing on a bitter note.

title: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2016 Glintzberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Fresh earthy notes join the subtle peach fruit on the nose. The palate counters with slightly bitter notes that seem slightly out of joint. Drink this while aromas are fresh.

title: Domaine Sauvat 2016 Demoiselles Gamay (Côtes d'Auvergne)
description: This ripe fruity wine is bursting with young red fruits. It has a fine structure that gives a core of dryness. It also has a crisp edge that brings out the fruit and the liveliness of this attractive wine. Ready to drink now.

title: Jidvei 2015 Demisec Gewurztraminer (Jidvei)
description: This semisweet wine has a flowery bouquet of jasmine and citrus blossom. The florality continues to the palate, combining with flavors of pineapple, ginger and apricot before a slightly sweet finish.

title: Matello 2013 Fool's Journey Deux Vert Vineyard Red (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Principally Syrah, with 6% Viognier (presumably cofermented), this is sourced from a vineyard planted by Patty Green. Some good grapes go into this wine, but it has emerged with an off-putting sweaty aroma that carries into the flavors. Apart from that there is thin cranberry fruit along with notes of lemon and unsalted peanuts.
